events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

events.description: Amazon's doorbell camera producer Ring has ended their partnership with Flock Safety, a tech surveillance company, as the two firms face a backlash over privacy. The trigger? A Super bowl commercial about a lost dog.

events.title: Is Netflix making us stupid?
events.description: Netflix is increasingly designing films and series for distracted, second-screen viewers. DW's Scott Roxborough asks what it means for storytelling, visual language and the future of cinema as an art form.

events.title: MSC: Germany's Merz urges new 'trans-Atlantic partnership'
events.description: During his speech at the Munich Security Conference, the German chancellor recognized there is a "deep rift" between Europe and the US under the Trump administration. He called for a revival of "trans-Atlantic trust."

events.title: As the telephone turns 150, are we hanging up on phone calls?
events.description: Today, 150 years after the invention of the telephone, it has never been easier to call someone. But in some ways, and for some people, picking up the phone is still a very hard thing to do.

events.title: UK decision to ban Palestine Action unlawful, court rules
events.description: The High Court's ruling comes after the pro-Palestinian group's co-founder launched a legal challenge against the ban. The ban, however, will remain in place while the government appeals.

events.title: New conspiracy theories hold that Jeffrey Epstein is alive and well
events.description: A number of social media users are claiming that late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is actually still alive and well. Their supposed proof? Some have shared images they claim show Epstein walking in Tel Aviv, while others have claimed that heâ€™s been playing Fortnite. Turns out the images were doctored, and the Fortnite account belongs to another user entirely. We take a look.

events.title: 'Europe managed to support Ukraine'
events.description: Gavin Lee is pleased to welcome, live from Munich, Arseniy Yatsenyuk, Former Ukrainian Prime Minister, who served in the critical time in the recent history of Ukraine, 2014 to 2016.

events.title: #CIA: Video aims to recruit #Chinese military officers as spies
events.description: The #CIA has posted a video on its YouTube channel targeting members of the #Chinese military in an attempt to #recruit them as spies. The video depicts a fictional disillusioned Chinese military officer who decides to contact the CIA and comes after a recent dramatic purge of China's top generals.

events.title: Are teenagers too young to scroll? Europe weighs social media bans for minors
events.description: Worries that too much time on social media may be hurting children's mental health, and creating addictions as harmful as alcohol or cigarettes, are sparking growing calls across Europe to block minors under the age of 15 or 16 from access to platforms.

events.title: Italy: 'Virgin' frescoes emerge from Pompeii suburb
events.description: Visitors have begun entering the restored Villa Poppaea, a luxury Roman residence near Pompeii, where new frescoes and artworks are being uncovered after centuries buried by the 79 AD eruption of Mount Vesuvius. The villa, once home to Poppaea Sabina, wife of Nero, is revealing vivid decorations, including a peacock fresco linked to the Roman goddess Juno, as conservation work nears completion.

events.title: February's unmissable TV: Steamy gay hockey, 'America's Next Top Model' controversy and more
events.description: February is delivering a packed slate of must-watch television. Critic Dheepthika Laurent reviews the French release of "Heated Rivalry", which brings a steamy, taboo-breaking hockey romance to new audiences, as well as the Netflix show that revisits the legacy and controversies of "America's Next Top Model". Legal drama fans can dive into a high-stakes new season of "The Lincoln Lawyer", with Mickey Haller facing his toughest case yet â€“ his own.

events.title: Starmer to claim 'lamps would go out across Europe' under Reform UK or Greens
events.description: Sir Keir Starmer will accuse parties like Reform UK and the Greens of being "soft on Russia", "weak on NATO" and more likely to leave the nation divided and defeated.

events.title: Team GB win first gold at 2026 Winter Olympics
events.description: Matt Weston has won gold in the men's singles skeleton competition, Team GB's first medal at the Winter Olympics in Italy.

events.title: Who is Matt Weston? The athlete who has won gold for Team GB
events.description: Matt Weston won gold in the men's singles skeleton competition, securing Team GB its first medal at the Winter Olympics in Italy.

events.title: Epstein's victims feared he secretly filmed them - emails suggest they were right
events.description: Sky News has found an email exchange from 2014 showing that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein asked a member of staff to install hidden video cameras at his home in Palm Beach, Florida.

events.description: No description available.

events.title: Thailandâ€™s ruling conservative party moves closer to forming new coalition government
events.description: Thailandâ€™s Bhumjaithai Party has moved closer to forming a new government after the Pheu Thai Party agreed to join it in a proposed coalition

events.title: Thousands rally in support of Nepal's former king and call for monarchy's return
events.description: Thousands of supporters have gathered outside Kathmandu airport to greet former king Gyanendra Shah and demand Nepal restore the monarchy

events.title: Mosque gunman wanted online fame. A New Zealand court has tried to curb that
events.description: New Zealand's Court of Appeal has finished hearing an appeal from the Christchurch mosque gunman, in proceedings that were quiet and tightly controlled

events.title: During the Winter Games, some Milan churches are teaching Olympic values to thousands of kids
events.description: A Milan church uses the buzz around the 2026 Winter Olympics to teach kids that sports values matter in everyday life

events.title: Judge orders jailed Guatemalan journalist JosÃ© RubÃ©n Zamora returned to house arrest
events.description: A judge has ordered that Guatemalan journalist JosÃ© RubÃ©n Zamora be returned to house arrest again while awaiting trial after spending nearly a year in jail in his latest stint of incarceration

events.title: Women and girls in science: Dismantling barriers, closing gender gaps
events.description: Although women are more likely than young men to pursue higher education, they make up only 35 per cent of science graduates.

events.title: In Bahrain; work, dignity and the quiet rise of home-grown enterprise
events.description: From a crochet hook in a Cairo living room to digital marketplaces reaching across borders, women entrepreneurs are demonstrating how creativity, persistence and targeted support can translate into livelihoods â€” even when formal employment is out of reach.

events.title: Arizona family sues hospital, says staff â€˜Uberedâ€™ sick son to sidewalk where he died
events.description: An Arizona family alleges hospital staff put their sick son in an Uber and dumped him at a homeless shelter, where he died hours later on a Phoenix sidewalk.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Ransom deadline passes, key evidence emerges in Nancy Guthrie case
events.description: This is a special edition of the Fox News True Crime Newsletter.

events.title: California middle school assistant principal nabbed in child sex sting
events.description: San JosÃ© Police police said a task force arrested multiple people, including a Sunrise Middle School assistant principal, who allegedly sought to have sex with minors.

events.title: Genealogy company exec slams Pima sheriff's 'devastating' move to ship Nancy Guthrie evidence to Florida lab
events.description: DNA testing company Othram slams Pima County Sheriff for sending Nancy Guthrie case evidence to Florida lab instead of FBI, calling decision "devastating."

events.title: Walmart sales records become critical evidence as FBI investigates Nancy Guthrie's disappearance
events.description: Walmart surveillance has become key evidence in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance as investigators use retail data to narrow suspects, expert Jason Pack says.

events.title: New Jersey teacher who slept with students at family bagel shop learns prison sentence
events.description: Former New Jersey teacher Julie Rizzitello sentenced to 10 years in prison for sexually assaulting two students she groomed at Wall High School.

events.title: Democrats push 'unconstitutional power grab' that could flip GOP seats and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: European nation votes to cap population at 10M in major immigration crackdown referendum
events.description: Switzerland will vote June 14 on capping population at 10 million as anti-immigration referendum gains momentum with population nearing 9.1 million.

events.title: Uproar after Iran named vice-chair of UN body promoting democracy, womenâ€™s rights
events.description: Iran's appointment as vice-chair of UN Commission for Social Development faces sharp criticism from human rights advocates and Iranian activists calling it a 'mockery'.

events.title: US forces complete withdrawal from strategic al-Tanf Garrison in Syria
events.description: The U.S. military has completed its withdrawal from al-Tanf Garrison in southern Syria, handing over control to government forces.

events.title: Iranian brutality: Nobel laureate fighting for life after barbaric assault at notorious prison
events.description: The Nobel Committee is demanding Iran stop alleged brutal abuse of peace laureate Narges Mohammadi, who has been imprisoned since December after attending a funeral.

events.title: Trump meets Netanyahu, says he wants Iran deal but reminds Tehran of â€˜Midnight Hammerâ€™ operation
events.description: President Donald Trump and Israeli prime minister signal uncertainty on Iran diplomacy after White House talks, with Trump pushing negotiations while keeping other options open.

events.title: Trump, Netanyahu to meet at White House in high-stakes talks on Iran, Gaza plan
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu meets President Donald Trump Wednesday to discuss Iran negotiations, as Washington weighs diplomacy against military action.
